intro: Consolida pubescens var. dissitiflora, commonly known as the hairy antirrhinum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy stems and foliage, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its showy, tubular flowers. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a nectar source for pollinators.
